noun.description: A receptacle shaped like a shrine or a cup with an arched cover, used in the Christian Church for the reservation of the Eucharist.
A canopy over an altar in a church, standing on four pillars.

origin: Mid 16th century: via medieval Latin from Greek kibōrion seed vessel of the water lily or a cup made from it. ciborium (sense 1) is probably influenced by Latin cibus food.
